lessons.title: Example: Columns Value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create two grid columns of 30px each.

Make sure to pick grid-template-columns followed by : and then 30, px, 30, px, ;.

lessons.title: Example: Columns Value  II
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create four columns of size 30px 40px 50px 60px.

Make sure to type 30px 40px 50px 60px.

lessons.title: Question: Grid Items
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's wrong with this code?

The grid item should be inside the grid containerThere should be multiple grid containersThere should be fewer grid items

The grid item should be inside the grid container.

lessons.title: Question: Grid Property
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which property should we use to transform an element into a grid?

The display propertyThe grid-template-columns propertyThe position property

The display property.

lessons.title: Question: Columns Value
lessons.interactiveContent:
How many grid columns will be created when we use grid-template-columns: 40px 60px 40px as part of the CSS rule for the parent element?

ThreeTwoFour

Make sure to pick Three.

lessons.title: Example: Pixel Units
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create two equal grid columns using pixel values.

Make sure to pick grid-template-columns, followed by 100px, and finally 100px.

lessons.title: Question: Additional Items
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens to an additional fifth grid item in a two grid-column?

It's sent to the next row, the third row in this caseIt remains on the same rowIt overlaps the fourth item

It's sent to the next row, the third row in this case.

lessons.title: Question: Fractional Units II
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we create columns using the following code?

The space available is evenly distributed across all the columnsThe remaining space is evenly distributed across the first two columnsThe remaining space is evenly distributed across the last two columns

The space available is evenly distributed across all the columns.

lessons.title: Example: Percentage Values
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create three equally sized columns.

Make sure to pick 30%, followed by 30%, and finally 30%.

lessons.title: Example: Repeat Function
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use the repeat() function to create four equally sized columns of 1fr width.

Make sure to pick repeat followed by ( and then 4, ,, 1fr, ).

lessons.title: Example: Repeat Function
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use the repeat() function to create two rows set to auto.

Make sure to type repeat(2, auto).

lessons.title: Question: Rows
lessons.interactiveContent:
How many grid rows are defined in the grid container?

Five grid rowsFour grid rowsSix grid rows

Five grid rows.

lessons.title: Question: Auto Value II
lessons.interactiveContent:
Keeping in mind that the grid container doesn't have a height property set, what does this code display?

Two rows that are only as tall as their contentA small row followed by a tall rowThree rows of equal size

Two rows that are only as tall as their content.

lessons.title: Example: Pixel Units
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create two grid rows using 60px 60px.

Make sure to pick 60px, followed by 60px.

lessons.title: Question: Percentage Units
lessons.interactiveContent:
How many grid items does this container have?

Four grid itemsThree grid itemsFive grid items

Four grid items.
